jtools.jls
Class JLs

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jtools.jls.JLs
public class JLs
extends java.lang.Object

The master module for the jls program.

See the man page for details of its functionality.

ignoreEmpty

outputLimit

public static int outputLimit
How wide a display to produce when outputing lists.

If -1, always display 1 item/line.

Otherwise, gives the # of characters we will attempt to limit output to. In the case of items wider than this, we will exceed this limit, using 1 item/line.

separator

public static final java.lang.String separator
The separator to use between columns in multi-column displays.

Constructor Detail

JLs

public JLs()
Method Detail

handlePackageNames

public static void handlePackageNames(java.lang.String[] names,
                                      int start)
Perform jls's functionality for a series of package names: names[start], names[start+1], ...

The current program settings are taken into account. An empty series of names is considered equivalent to the series consisting of just the empty package name.

names must be non-null and start>=0

print

public static void print(java.lang.String s)
All jls routines should call this instead of System.out.print

println

public static void println(java.lang.String s)
All jls routines should call this instead of System.out.println

println

public static void println()
All jls routines should call this instead of System.out.println

printSeparator

public static void printSeparator()
Print a blank line as a seperator on System.out.print, unless no output has been printed yet, in which case, do nothing.

displayPackageName

public static void displayPackageName(Tree P,
                                      boolean isHeader)
Display a package name via println. If isHeader is set, proceeds it by a separator line and puts a ':' at the end of the package name.

handlePackageName

public static void handlePackageName(java.lang.String packageName,
                                     boolean alwaysDisplayHeader)
Perform jls's functionality for a single package name.

The current program settings are taken into account. A header is displayed before any other normal output, regardless of the program settings, if alwaysDisplayHeader is true.

packageName must be non-null

lookupPackage

public static Tree lookupPackage(Tree namespace,
                                 java.lang.String packageName)
lookup a package in namespace using a package-name String.

- handles errors by complaining to System.err then returning null.

- ignores types while searching; in particular, unlike Resolve.lookup, ambiguous names (aka, names for both a type and a package) do not cause any problems.

listPackage

public static void listPackage(Tree P,
                               boolean displayTypes,
                               boolean displayPackages)
List the contents of a package without any header.

Displays types and/or packages depending on its arguments.

Uses the current program settings except for displayTypes and displayPackages, which are overridden by the arguments.

maxItem

public static int maxItem(java.util.Vector list)
Compute the size of the longest String in a Vector of non-null Strings.

printSpaces

protected static void printSpaces(int n)

printList

public static void printList(java.util.Vector list)
Display a Vector of non-null Strings, using multiple columns if possible on System.out, so as to produce the shortest output possibile consistent with the variable outputLimit above.

packageContents

public static java.util.Vector packageContents(Tree P,
                                               boolean includeTypes,
                                               boolean includePackages)
Compute the contents of a package for display. Returns a Vector of Strings, where each String represents one entry of the package. The entries are in sorted order.

Includes package entries if includePackages is set. Includes types with source if includeTypes and includeSource are true. Includes types with binaries if includeTypes and includeBinary are true.

useAbsolute and markEntries are taken into account.

isEmpty

public static boolean isEmpty(Tree P)
Is package P empty?

I.e., does P contain any source or binary files or any subpackages?

usage

public static void usage()
Print out our usage information on System.err

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main procedure for the jls command
